title: NXP stock rises as revenue tops Street view
text: NXP Semiconductor NV NXPI, +2.64% shares rose in the extended session Monday after the chip maker reported slightly better-than-expected revenue. NXP shares rose 5.6% after hours, following a 2.7% rise in the regular session to close at $108.65. The company reported third-quarter net income of $119 million, or 38 cents a share, compared with $1.82 billion, or $5.60 a share, in the year-ago period. The company did not provide adjusted earnings a share figures. Revenue declined to $2.27 billion from $2.45 billion in the year-ago quarter. Analysts surveyed by FactSet had forecast revenue of $2.24 billion. NXP expects revenue of $2.24 billion to $2.3 billion, while analysts had forecast on revenue of $2.27 billion. "Looking forward, we continue to believe that our product portfolio investments are addressing our customers' long-term requirements, while in the short-term the global demand environment appears to have stabilized, but the intermediate demand environment continues to be uncertain, and has not markedly improved," said Richard Clemmer, NXP chief executive, in a statement.
